entry.title: Add /run/imageloader to file allowlist on ChromeOS.
entry.content:
The new video screen saver on ChromeOS is rendered using a file://

URI pointing to the desired video on disc. The videos are currently

in /usr/share/chromeos-assets (rootfs), but they're being migrated to

DLC. This wasn't a problem before because /usr/share/chromeos-assets is

already in the allowlist. The directory where DLC installs its

packages though (/run/imageloader) is not.



Bug: b:289085706

Change-Id: I016782fae8f0645ba515b2a80d92da01ea9b8155

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4867111

entry.title: Let InstallableIconFetcher fetch raw favicon
entry.content:
`LargeFaviconProvider::GetLargeIconImageOrFallbackStyleForPageUrl` will

decode and scale the favicon to the ideal size. This wouldn't work for

us if we want to record the raw icon size and control the min size.



This CL uses `LargeFaviconProvider::GetLargeIconRawBitmapForPageUrl`

to get the raw icon, process the icon in a background thread, and adds

a feature flag to control the min icon size.





Bug: 1462726

Change-Id: I60141437cf63d5aa60fe46f1024df11173672f9d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4863859

entry.title: Revert "OOBE: Fix empty GAIA screen bug"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5f8c11eaa9f10433f725dcf707e26247c3d57f47.



Reason for revert: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Builder/59319/overview



Original change's description:

> OOBE: Fix empty GAIA screen bug

>

> In the current implementation, when GAIA screen is shown without any of

> the methods to load the online GAIA is called, the user ends up with an

> empty screen. One example where this issue happens is when `MaybeSetToPreviousScreen()` method in WizardController is called.

>

> To ensure that the screen is never shown with an empty webview, we set

> a default value for `gaia_configs.gaia_path` and return it to the

> default value each time the screen is hidden.

>

> Bug: b:293619961

> Change-Id: Id07bf98eba4f1671443055c9a57061965928ce90

entry.title: Add contact email for builders owned by Chrome Browser Infra
entry.content:
The WoA EngProd team and Chrome Browser Infra team are working together

to provide signals to builder owners when their builders are slow,

failing often, or otherwise unhealthy or low-value.



This change will add team email addresses to gardened builders so that

owner teams are notified when there are problems with their builders.



To the owner team: If you do not have permission to vote, please comment

to give consent for those builders to be owned by your team.



Bug: 1401558

entry.title: Replace use of isolate_name with test.
entry.content:
The isolate_name field can be set in tests that will be put in the

isolated_scripts test type. The meaning of the field is the same as for

the test field in the gtest test type and the recipe supports either

test or isolate_name being set. Rather than have different fields that

do the same thing in different test types, this CL standardizes on using

test as the name of the field.



Bug: 1475835

Change-Id: I5a25d794bf65af74cc386ce07ebb81f8ce9a9e9e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4865091

entry.content:
Add a "--no-clean" arg to test_runner.py. This arg would cause

a "--no-clean" arg added to cros_test and preserve the deployed

files in /usr/local/cros_test on DUT. Devs could save a few seconds

doing incremental deploying files and also play with the files on DUT.

entry.title: OOBE: Fix empty GAIA screen bug
entry.content:
In the current implementation, when GAIA screen is shown without any of

the methods to load the online GAIA is called, the user ends up with an

empty screen. One example where this issue happens is when `MaybeSetToPreviousScreen()` method in WizardController is called.



To ensure that the screen is never shown with an empty webview, we set

a default value for `gaia_configs.gaia_path` and return it to the

default value each time the screen is hidden.



Bug: b:293619961

Change-Id: Id07bf98eba4f1671443055c9a57061965928ce90

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4835691

Reviewed-by: Danila Kuzmin

entry.title: Provide Mp4Muxer feature flag.
entry.content:
It provides feature flag of MediaRecorderEnableMp4Muxer that

is disabled by default.



When feature flag is enabled and MediaRecorder options has

right combination of type and codec, then it isTypeSupported will

return true and internal API such as ActualMimeType returns

correct string.



However, we have blocking bug of support codec_description

on audio and video encoded stream so creating MP4 blob

is not fully supported yet even with flag enabled.



Bug: 1072056

Change-Id: Ibc9e8a2f5c8cd0096b555a3cdc9a0b4793c9c427



Binary-Size: Size increase is unavoidable, add new feature of mp4 muxer.

entry.title: arc-a11y: Ignore meaningless nodes in navigation
entry.content:
Accessible name for Android clickable nodes are computed in

AccessibilityNodeInfoDataWrapper::ComputeNameFromContents. Thus, if node

is clickable but it doesn't have any names, it doesn't make sense to

focus on it.



In order to prevent double-focusing on some nodes that are wrapped by

clickables, and making announcements twice, this CL makes such nodes

skipped.



R=akihiroota@chromium.org, sahok@chromium.org



Bug: b:277257709

Test: PlayStore profile icon is not doubly focused.

Test: ChromeVoxBackgroundTest

Change-Id: Ida8b81cea29ca7cd74028c0384692b40f99692aa

needed for H.264 decoder because our existing tests only have one slice

per frame.

entry.title: Add initial Surface Swap for Cardboard
entry.content:
Adds an initial Surface Buffer Swap for Cardboard after setting up the

Surface. This swap causes the surface to render black rather than

staying transparent. In lieu of getting the Browser Overlay hooked up

that would take over if the page never submitted a frame or hangs, this

will ensure that the screen is blanked out so that users won't get

potentially confused by any "Exit VR" buttons on the page and can more

easily see the "X" button to exit the session.



Bug: 1429376

Change-Id: I80c9535d4664f2e96a067d87a81dd72083fe3a24

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4865589

Reviewed-by: Brandon Jones

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1196864}

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] Fix missing favicons
entry.content:
TabListFaviconProvider caches single instances of common Globe and

Chrome favicons for re-use throughout the UI. This is efficient, but

has a gotcha in that all the users of these drawables share the same

backing ConstantState. Thus if the drawable is manipulated somewhere it

will affect all other instances.



MultiThumbnailCardProvider was calling setBounds() on the shared

drawables with a non-zero x,y position and a different size. This led

to these favicons mysteriously vanishing from non-grouped tabs.



I investigated the following options for fixes:



Option 1: cache old bounds and reset bounds after setBounds(). I thought

this would cause flickering, but since all the work is UI thread. It is

actually ok. We will go with this since it is simpler.



Option 2: make a mutable copy of the drawable. Unfortunately,

RoundedBitmapDrawable doesn't support getConstantState() so we can't

rely on `drawable.getConstantState().newDrawable().mutate()` to get

a mutable copy for this purpose. This is also expensive.



Option 3: translate and scale canvas. This worked, but has a bunch of

edgecases. See PS1 for this implementation which we have now moved away from.

1) If bounds don't exist set them and proceed as before because the

drawable is not shared.

2) If the bounds do exist ensure they are located at 0, 0. I couldn't

figure out why this would happen, but experienced it in local

testing.

3) Translate and scale the canvas so we don't see any visual change

when drawing the favicon, but we also don't change the bounds of the

drawable.



This should be a no-op visually other than fixing the missing favicons.

See bug for how this was reproduced.



Bug: 1482737

Change-Id: Icde5168b2560e4432c2cd68af35429548a4c520f

entry.title: Fix encoding bug in print_histogram_names.py.
entry.content:
The histogram_xml_files() routine in

//tools/metrics/histograms/print_histogram_names.py was using

`open(fname)`, which uses Python's default encoding. On

Linux and Mac, this is utf-8, but on windows, it is cp1252.



As a result, trying to decode certain utf-8 byte sequences can raise

exceptions. And one of those sequences (a pair of smart quotes)

was checked in in r1195461.



This CL fixes the bug.

entry.title: Fix loading of precedence policies from Windows registry.
entry.content:
Loading of precedence policies from Windows registry is broken as the

behavior of PolicyMap::MergeFrom was modified to separate the merging of

precedence policies and all other policies: https://crrev.com/c/4739415.



However, not all MergeFrom uses were updated to reflect this change. For

example, the call in PolicyLoaderWin::LoadChromePolicy() was untouched,

meaning only non-precedence policies are currently loaded from registry.



This change reverts the culprit CL and fixes the failing dependency

(LocalTestPolicyLoader) which is not yet launched.

entry.title: Roll tflite_support to f248072f68895fd3a156cb2b5eedda02a9449049.
entry.content:
The primary motivation here is to unblock a followup for prefixing

the ASSIGN_OR_RETURN() and RETURN_IF_ERROR() macros to avoid naming

clashes. The internal implementation macros were prefixed upstream

first, which required rolling Chrome's copy.



The patch process itself has been streamlined somewhat, and patches that

are no longer needed have been dropped, with explanations of why they

are no longer necessary.



Patches that now live upstream:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tflite-support/commit/8fd106e45498bdce380a71beb35e3cf4c0d3a6cc

- 0007-Fix-TFLite-build-errors-on-linux-when-using-the-syst.patch



https://github.com/tensorflow/tflite-support/commit/7352c22af438ab677a064181415a0f8a95f51897

- 0008-fix-unused-variable-in-task-utils.patch



https://github.com/tensorflow/tflite-support/commit/6c737932da1486f01ca9f102a4512fec93eb61e9

- 0015-Use-abs-from-std-in-tflite-task-core-Category.patch



https://github.com/tensorflow/tflite-support/commit/c3c40d220a0836df58d856b93042a6dcfe22eeac

- 0017-tflite-removed-shims.patch

- 0018-adding-text-embedder-to-build.patch



Patches removed for other reasons:

- 0011-fix-unused-errors-on-win.patch: the build still works fine

without this patch.

- 0013-remove-big-testdata-files.patch: format-patch produces a giant

diff for this, partially defeating the point of removing the large

files to begin with. Instead, this is now step 6 in the update

process.

- 0014-run-clang-format.patch: the clang-format patch generates a large

diff. Using clang-format at all makes it harder to generate and/or

update patches as well. Instead, just drop the clang-format step

altogether in favor of disabling formatting for third-party code.



Change-Id: I0d596160bc881b4ba7b648218705db842d874792

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4853183

Reviewed-by: Robert Ogden

Commit-Queue: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1196826}

entry.title: Mojo WebUI bindings: Don't always generate with .mojom.js files
entry.content:
It is possible for the mojom_js_generator to be invoked outside of a

mojom() rule to generate individual .mojom.js files. In this case,

arguments like whether to use TypeScript for WebUI bindings are not set.

Since mojom-webui.js files aren't actually needed to generate .mojom.js

files and are generated only because they happen to be created by the

same script, only generate them when they are explicitly requested by a

mojom() target (i.e. when webui_module_path is set and

use_typescript_sources is not).



Bug: 1437820

entry.title: [3PCD] [Mode B] Introduce experiment pref
entry.content:
Define the 3PCD Experiment client-wide (local store) and profile prefs.

The client-wide prefs will store a client's membership status in the

Mode B experiment and its registration status in the synthetic trial.

Use an integer pref for cohort so these values correspond to the enum

value for the feature param tpcd::experimentkCohort and a boolean for

isRegistered. The profile pref will store if the client is eligible and

that will be used in combination with the onboarding status from the UX

onboarding service to tell the client-wide manager whether to register

the client for the synthetic trial.



Later CLs will introduce the filters to determine a client's membership

status in the experiment. Once determined eligible and registered in the

synthetic trial, set this pref to the correct experiment arm. If

determined ineligible at this point, immediately set that in the

experiment pref. Once a client is marked "ineligible" this pref should

not change. It is possible for a previously eligible client to become

ineligible (by signing into a profile that is ineligible), but mostly

this should just be set once.



Change-Id: I554a082bdc8803065353367dbfa8363d6694ac45

entry.title: [wpt-metadata] Always treat CANCELED builds as incomplete
entry.content:
`update-metadata` incorrectly treated CANCELED builds as valid only

because they're "finished" (not running). Treat both CANCELED and

INFRA_FAILURE builds as "incomplete" instead to trigger a warning and

prompt to continue.



`rebaseline-cl` didn't face this issue because it has a separate

mechanism for identifying additional "builders without results".



Bug: None

Test: git cl issue 4865742

Test: ./blink_tool.py update-metadata --dry-run --patchset=1

Test: 5 builds reported as CANCELED.

entry.title: Use base::optional_ref in FetchContext methods
entry.content:
One of these methods showed up while I was looking at where the compiler

was and wasn't optimizing out a std::optional safety check. In code like

the following:



void Foo(const absl::optional& t) {

if (t) {

A();

B(t->thingy);

}

}



If A() is not inlined (quite common because of -Oz, see

https://crbug.com/1396134), the compiler cannot delete the safety check

embedded in operator->, because it is possible the caller bound t to a

global that A() then mutates back to nullopt. The compiler needs to

preserve the safety check to account for this possibility.



Passing base::optional_ref by value avoids this because the

compiler knows the underlying pointer does not escape, only the pointee.

It also avoids some copies in some cases.



Go ahead and fix this manually while I'm looking at it anyway.



Bug: 1129604

Change-Id: I01e48087503fb739cb8c43d27b6f3b95b3529dce

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4860473

entry.title: Always use the latest chromedriver.
entry.content:
chromedriver should be compatible with most of Chrome binaries as there is no special flags used for Chrome. This will also allow us for newer

features (e.g. browserStartupTimeout) in chromedriver as well as supporting older versions of Chrome.



There can be cases when the chromedriver is not compatible with older

versions of Chrome we are testing. This CL adds an option such that

it can download the same/compatible version of chromedriver.



This is a rework of:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4777430

entry.title: Fix dir attribute matching for text-based input
entry.content:
To comply with HTML standard, we need to make two changes:

1. If dir attribute is undefined and it is the telephone input element,

return "ltr" [1].

2. If dir attribute is auto and element is textarea or input type text,

search, telephone, url or email then follow step 1 at [2].



[1] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dom.html#attr-dir-undefined-state

[2] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dom.html#auto-directionality



Change-Id: I7bc1ba4fd0eb19de6bca7f36985119b627edcaab

entry.title: Implement MiniGBM BO Management.
entry.content:
Buffers were allocated by MiniGBM previously for decoding however the

fake decoder had no way of accessing these buffer objects.



This update sets up a device holder for MiniGBM which will be able to

map and unmap buffers for decoding. Each of these mappings will be

stored in a bo_mapping object which each surface will create in it's

constructor.



This update will not result in successful decoding however will result

in being able to access buffers created by MiniGBM from the

fake_surface.



BUG: b:261660716

entry.title: Lacros Download SysUI integration: Implement ShowInBrowser()
entry.content:
This hooks up ShowInBrowser from the DownloadStatusUpdater::Delegate to

the download toolbar button.



ShowInBrowser() is called with a download guid and causes the download

bubble to open the bubble to the most specific dialog (i.e., the primary

view or the security view if the download has a warning).



If no bubble can be opened, it falls back to opening chrome://downloads.



Design doc: http://shortn/_Qn9XZRHnST (dmblack@)



Demo screencast (patched on top of prototype CL crrev.com/c/4781839

to enable notifications):

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1uZVHODkPhvZAdMPLnzLnYdutsq7evLoy

entry.title: Make PrivacyPreferencesManager an ObserableSupplier
entry.content:
Explicitly update observers when PrivacyPreferencesManagerImpl sees updates, instead of observing SharePreferences. This is done by delegating the task to an ObservableSupplierImpl.



This CL also adds an API to expose #isUsageAndCrashReportingPermitted as an ObservableSupplier, so sub-modules do not have to add //c/b/privacy:java as a dependency, as well as expanding the visibility list

entry.title: [omnibox][calc] Remove duplicates from cache.
entry.content:
Before this CL, the calc cache keeps duplicates. This has 2 problems:



1) Reduces cache capacity. If the user repeatedly types e.g. '1+1',

it'll keep pushing off other cached calc matches.



2) Shows duplicate matches. E.g. the calc matches '1+1 ' (trailing

whitespace) and '1+1' won't be deduped in `AutocompleteResult` since

they'll have different URLs. By deduping the calc provider, we can

dedupe using the match contents instead of the URL.



Bug: 1482449

entry.title: WebSQL: Fix deprecation trial errors
entry.content:
This change fixes errors when trying to use WebSQL

with a deprecation trial token. It removes explicit checks

to blink::features and blink::switches on `openDatabase`

and relies on `runtime_features.cc` [1] and

`content_switch_dependent_feature_overrides.cc` [2] to

properly propagate the enabled flag to `RuntimeEnabledFeature`.

The discrepancy occurred when only `RuntimeEnableFeature` was

enabled by OT token.



Tests for flags and switches are moved into a browsertest

to better capture the full flag propagation behavior.

Enterprise policy, OT token, chrome://flags, command line

tested manually as well.



[1] https://crsrc.org/c/content/child/runtime_features.cc

[2] https://crsrc.org/c/content/public/common/content_switch_dependent_feature_overrides.cc
